item.title: IceCubesApp
item.description:
As we see a lot of new users, I think it‚Äôs time for a new round of ice cubes #introductionIce Cubes is available on the App Store for iOS, iPadOS and macOS, it‚Äôs a fast, customisable, easy to use client.- Pin any local timeline from any instance!
- Quote toot!
- Easy access to your lists and followed tags!
- Proper direct messages interface.
- It's 100% free and Open source!https://apps.apple.com/us/app/ice-cubes-for-mastodon/id6444915884

item.title: Roxana Zeraati
item.description:
After finally finding a place that feels more like home on mastodon, here goes the #introduction:
I am a PhD candidate in #computationalneuroscience at the University of T√ºbingen and Max Planck Institute for Biological Cybernetics, Germany.I am interested in understanding the relationship between brain computations and dynamics. That's why I study population neural dynamics and their correlation structure underlying different behaviors (e.g., during selective attention tasks).Looking forward to interactions in this space!

item.title: Carl T. Bergstrom
item.description: It is now painfully clear that no local government, state or federal agency, or other civic institution should be using Twitter for any purpose other than directing people to alternative platforms. Using the platform for anything other than a last ditch backup for any kind of emergency communication is clearly a disaster waiting to happen.

item.title: Peter Moleman
item.description:
It appears to me that Juarrero describes the predictive process in terms of complex dynamical systems:
"models and other abstractions such as order parameters represent constraint regimes that filter, code, and calibrate internal as well as incoming signals in terms of systemwide and continuous relations of dependence."Juarrero, Alicia. Context Changes Everything (pp. 161-162). MIT Press. Kindle Edition.
#Neuroscience #ComplexDynamicalSystems #Complexity #FinalCause #CircularCausality

item.description: My coffee! #comics #funny #coffee

item.title: D. Elisabeth Glassco
item.description:
Onesimus, a Boston enslaved man, saved hundreds of people from the horrors of smallpox in 1721. His contributions to science reverberate to this day b/c his knowledge led to what became the 1st vaccine-related study in America. Onesimus‚Äôs story illustrates the degree to which reputable men of science de¬≠pended on the testimony & experience of Africans in dealing with a dreaded disease.1/24#StillWeRise #Medicine #BlackHistory
#BlackMastodon
#Histodons #History
‚Ä®@blackmastodon@a.gup.pe @BlackMastodon@chirp.social

item.title: Dena Goldblatt
item.description: 2nd attempt at Mastodon after the latest twitter limits -- account just migrated over from #ScienceMastodon, so time for a new #introduction? 7th year (it's time to graduate) PhD candidate in #neuroscience at NYU in the @schoppik lab with interests in #development #circuits #synapses #zebrafish #teaching and all things #evodevo / circuit assembly & function. I also follow #baseball and am a recently converted #redsox to #phillies fan until the Sox give me something to root for üòÇ

item.title: Heidy Khlaaf (ŸáÿßŸäÿØŸä ÿÆŸÑÿßŸÅ)
item.description: The rate limiting incident in Twitter isn't really what pushed me over to use Mastodon more and more. Currently there is a hashtag on Twitter related to the French riots that's calling on the expulsion of all Muslim, African, and Arab immigrants from the entirety of Europe. The trending hashtag (at #2) is filled with images encouraging mass killings and lynchings of Arabs. There is no come back from this.

item.title: Eugen Rochko
item.description: So, weekend tally: The number of active users across Mastodon rose by 294K, and posting activity roughly tripled. Lots of new sign-ups, but also many returning users. Fun times!

item.title: Sainsbury Wellcome Centre
item.description: We are excited to share that Dr Julia Harris will join SWC as a Group Leader in January.The research conducted in the Harris lab will follow the activity of individual neurons across cycles of wake and sleep. The team will examine the cellular mechanisms involved in sleep-mediated circuit reorganisation and how these changes influence and refine behaviour across repeated cycles of wake and sleep. Find out more: https://www.sainsburywellcome.org/web/research-news/julia-harris-open-sleep-lab-swc

item.title: Gina Poe
item.description: Hey Mastodon users! This is my first post as I just opened my account migrating from @doctorpoe on twitter. I hope to find my old friends and make new ones among the mastodon conoscenti.
